bibl.title: Hera and the Return of Charaxos.
The Newest Sappho: P. Sapph. Obbink and P. GC inv. 105, Frs. 1-4 = Studies in Archaic and Classical Greek Song. 2

bibl.note: P. Coll. privées: P. Green Inv. 105 (= M.-P.3 1445.01; LDAB 341738) + P. Coll. privées [P. Sapph. Obbink] (= M.-P.3 1445.02; LDAB 341738). - Introduction: Hera in the Charaxos Poem. - Sappho's Hera. - The ""Lesbian triad"" sanctuary. - Hera as maritime goddess in the archaic Mediterranean. - Hera and Zeus in the Charaxos Poem.
bibl.seg: Deborah Boedeker, Hera and the Return of Charaxos.

Anton Bierl & André Lardinois (edd.), The Newest Sappho: P. Sapph. Obbink and P. GC inv. 105, Frs. 1-4 = Studies in Archaic and Classical Greek Song. 2 = Mnemosyne. Supplements. 392 (Leiden - Boston, 2016) pp. 188-207, 1 fig.

P. Coll. privées: P. Green Inv. 105 (= M.-P.3 1445.01; LDAB 341738) + P. Coll. privées [P. Sapph. Obbink] (= M.-P.3 1445.02; LDAB 341738). - Introduction: Hera in the Charaxos Poem. - Sappho's Hera. - The ""Lesbian triad"" sanctuary. - Hera as maritime goddess in the archaic Mediterranean. - Hera and Zeus in the Charaxos Poem.
